intro: Hieracium obellipticum, commonly known as the narrow-elliptic hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its yellow flowers are arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Hieracium obellipticum is often found in open habitats and is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
